title: Trapped on bootloader, Slot Unbootable, Device State locked
content:
Hi, today I woked up to my Pixel 2 on bootloader mode, I tried recovery but then it showed "ERROR: Slot unbootable: Load error" and it won't enter into recovery mode again.

This phone has stock android, I'm a techie and have rooted android phones in the past so I researched how to sideload a stock image back again but the phone's device state is locked and when I tried unlocking it using fastboot it says "FAILED (remote: 'Flashing Unlock is not allowed')". Since I can't boot to enable dev tools and unlock the option I'm trapped at the bootloader screen.

Is there any command to unlock using fastboot? I read that there are OEM commands that might need a token to do that.

Any help provided will be much appreciated, It's not a cheap phone and it really hurts me to loose it and all the time and hustle to repair it and time spent without a phone is really annoying.
